sub_title: Interim HR in broadest sense | Strategic approach, yet pragmatic and flexible in implementation
summary:
Profile: 

Strategic, yet hands-on approach, able to be effective in complex international matrix organizations, understands dynamics between HQ and local organisations / business units, easily accepted as trusted advisor and sparring partner by senior management levels, intuitive stakeholdermanagement, expert knowledge in change (communication) management, leadership and development, pragmatic approach, can build bridges across disciplines and cultures, strong in program- and projectmanagement, 'gets things done', 'up to speed' fast, comfortable in new roles and settings, knows how to bring a function to a next level, can interact with all levels, in- and outside of the organization, well developed organizational sensitivity, curious, creative in finding solutions. Interested in innovation, technology and (business) impact of societal trends like ageing and growing population and energy transition.

Keywords:
*Strategic HR
*People Development
*Talent Development
*Leadership and Management Development
*Talent Acquisition
*Leadership and organization development
*Culture and organisation development

profile_positions.description:
HF HR & Leadership is my own consultancy practice centered around HR transformation, strategy and implementation, leadership & development projects. With the (end)goal in mind, but with a pragmatic and hands on approach in implementation, offering HR solutions in the broadest sense in order to achieve your (strategic) goals as a company in a fast, down to earth and sustainable way. Building on different HR systems that might already be there, alignment and coming to one HR approach for your different entities or building a people agenda fully aligned with your company strategy, based on the latest HR insights, are a few examples of solutions I offer.

Recent assignments:
Scale up in cybersecurity, private equity backed, (high) tech, broad (interim) role in HR and OD
Start up in healthcare, building a platform, building recruitment and HR infrastructure from scratch

profile_positions.description:
Main responsibilities:
• Identify global key positions within Elekta and redesign the global succession planning process using common, understandable language and developing the necessary tools. 
• Create momentum at Executive Management level by actively “lobbying” and sharing insights about people and organization development results within the global R&D organization and the changes implemented within the Veenendaal operation.
• Draw attention from the Board and Executive Management to create buy-in and get a final “go” for a global leadership program.
• Design, develop and implement a global leadership program that includes leadership, high-potential, coaching and mentoring programs.
• Incorporate and integrate leadership cornerstones in HR processes including recruitment, performance appraisal and employee development by taking stakeholders on a “virtual journey” translating “high-over strategy” into manageable and practical information and action plans.
• Develop and promote an understandable vision on learning and development for all employees based on the 70:20:10 principle that increases employability.
• Monitor and support building a sustainable people pipeline.
• Build a Centre of Excellence (CoE) on leadership, people and organization development simultaneously with building a global L&D community that empowers leaders to embody and inspire employee growth.
• Assume responsibility (as member of the global HR MT) for developing Elekta’s Strategic People Agenda.

Results:
• Redesigned and implemented a global succession and talent review process providing, for the first time, a full overview of replacement leaders and quality of the leaderbench.
• Successfully Introduced a global leadership program 
• Developed and implemented a High Potential Development Program.
profile_positions.title: Global VP Leadership, People and Organization Development

profile_positions.description:
I was responsible for setting up an HR infrastructure for the global R&D function (1,500 employees) in 5 locations (USA, Sweden, UK, Netherlands and China). In this position, I managed 2 direct and 5 indirect reports and was member CTO (Chief Technical Officer) Management Team.

Main responsibilities:
• Develop a new organizational blueprint based on  a process-based way of working.
• Build insights and “take inventory” per location in all people processes as input for developing and implementing a plan for structuring the HR function within R&D.
• Organize face-to-face sessions with each of the 5 site leaders to provide and share insights on all global key people processes, create buy-in and explain the strategy behind restructuring the HR.
• Redesign the R&D organization based on shared responsibility, dedicated global clustering of expertise, dedicated ownership and accountability for products/product lines.
• Initiate monthly conference calls with site leaders and site HR to share best practices, collect KPIs and create benchmarks.
• Launch an awareness project to change the outlook on HR  to a global & outside-in focus to make leaders aware of their HR responsibility.
• Develop and support setting up a global HR R&D community that learns to share information and work together.
• Implement a career framework to improve making use of existing and new resources/competences based on right competencies, right cost and right location. 
• Promote Learning & Development as concept within the global R&D organization.
• Position R&D leadership from scratch by introducing a learning culture.

Results:
• Created and delivered a complete, global  overview of the R&D organization based on facts and figures.
• Enhanced understanding among site leaders about their own leadership roles.
• Prepared and developed the members in the HR community to take HR to the next level.
• Renewed and outlined a global R&D HR function based on global thinking instead of local thinking.
profile_positions.title: Global VP HR R&D (Engineering), Innovation & Portfolio

profile_positions.description:
In this position I was member of  the Dutch MT and the global HR MT. The Dutch subsidiary has 220 employees in R&D, Manufacturing, Supply Chain, Marketing and Services. My “marching orders” were to execute a downsizing operation (as part of a global cost cutting program, following the recommendations by McKinsey to adopt process-based working methods and reducing the global headcount by 300 people) and to transform the HR department to a business partner position with emphasis on employee development.

Main responsibilities:
• Develop a social plan in collaboration with the works council and trade unions to prepare for the downsizing operation in Veenendaal.
• Initiate and promote development of HR analytics and an HR dashboard (KPIs) and champion the use of Workday HR software.
• Analyze and translate business expectations related to the HR role into action plans.
• Discuss business input and the transformation process of HR with the HR people (3 direct reports) to develop a road map to increase visibility and transform the “classic” HR contribution to learning how to be an HR business partner.
• Introduced Learning & Development in Veenendaal and assign the implementation to one of the HR team members.
• Initiate and increase awareness for employability and development of employees by implementing the 70:20:10 learning principle.
• Upgraded and professionalized the services delivered by third parties (lease company, Occupational Health & Safety and other suppliers).

Results:
• Successfully completed the downsizing operation and delivered a social plan for employees that were made redundant.
• Developed and delivered a “mini-MBA” for the local leaders as “kick-off” for Learning & Development (how to create general managers, working with business cases and personal development goals).
• Delivered individual development plans for all employees in Veenendaal.
• Invigorated the HR department by changing the focus and by changes in staffing and roles.
profile_positions.title: HR Director Netherlands

profile_positions.description:

About 70% of business generated is repeat business. In addition, Harbour Fields has supported several start-ups in the Dutch market by building initial management teams.

Main responsibilities:
• Promote Harbour Fields in a variety of ways to generate business.
• Build and maintain contacts with clients and prospects and act as sparring partner for senior management.
• Execute search assignments for senior level executive roles and specialist roles from initial intake to contract negotiations.
• Fulfill interim management assignments for senior HR positions.
• Lead change projects and development programs for various clients.

Results:
•Built this agency from scratch to a healthy and profitable business.
•Completed well over 190 assignments.
•Developed and managed a 3-days workshop for one of my clients focused on “translating” corporate values and corporate mission to the Dutch operation and situation.
•Developed and conducted a workshop “Leadership in Life Sciences” for Nefarma (Dutch busine ss association for the pharmaceutical industry).
profile_positions.title: Founder & Managing Director
